channel.title: Client or .jar Debugging
channel.description:
Hello there, I'm sorry if I'm putting this in the wrong section, but anyways I just wanted to know if there's anyway to get the .java files from a .jar file or to be able to EDIT the .class files. All I know is that I can open a .jar with JD-GUI and see the .class files, but I can't really do anything with them or edit them. If it's possible to edit and do changes to the .class files, please tell me how :)
Thanks, Nael

item.title: Client or .jar Debugging
item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

sspoke:

with JD-GUI you see the .java files from the .class files or even open up the .jar file. To edit them you need to click the Save to zip folder in JD-GUI then extract it to a folder make a batch file yourself for a compiler and a batch file for a runner and edit anything you want.

Thanks a lot!!!

But how can I make my own Run batch file? :S

Read full topic

item.description:

Use your favorite bytecode editing library
